intro: Viguiera amphichlora, commonly known as the Mexican heather, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils, showing a preference for full sun exposure. Its foliage is gray-green, with narrow, linear leaves that help reduce water loss in arid conditions. Viguiera amphichlora is valued in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in drought-tolerant landscapes.
